description: ORDER DISMISSING CASE: Plaintiffs' fee-paid complaint is dismissed as barred by the doctrine of sovereign immunity and because the allegations are frivolous. The Clerk of Court is respectfully directed to enter judgment dismissing the action, ma il a copy of this Memorandum and Order to the pro se Plaintiffs, and note the mailing on the docket. Although Plaintiffs paid the filing fee to commence this action, the Court certifies pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1915(a)(3) that any appeal would no t be taken in good faith and, therefore, in forma pauperis status is denied for purpose of an appeal. Coppedge v. United States, 269 U.S. 438, 444-45 (1962).Ordered by Judge Orelia E. Merchant on 6/12/2024.  (CS) (Main Document 11 replaced on 6/17/2024) (JP).
